page.title: 01Upton Grey and its Environs
page.content: Upton Grey is situated midst good corn growing farmland some 5 miles SE of Basingstoke and 2\ miles SW of Odiham. There is also some grazing for cattle and sheep and the country is inter- spersed with woods. Fields tend to be large but there are old hedgerows remaining and replanting is being carried out. Farming is the main industry but on the outskirts of the village there is a flourishing haulage business and there is some building work. Most of the village's residents work outside the immediate area. Amongst the important houses are Hoddington House, Upton Grey House and the Manor House. The village is attractive and self sufficient with its church, shop, post office, inn, hall and pond. The vicar is shared with neighbouring villages. The River Whitewater rises at Bidden to the NW.
